title: Alloro 2012 Estate Riservata Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: A knockout effort, this features perfectly ripened fruit flavors of berries, plums and cherries adorned with baking spices. There's a suggestion of candied citrus rind as well, but it's the superlush fruit that rocks on through a lengthy finish.

title: Ayoub 2013 Brittan Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Matching tart red fruit to the vineyard's characteristic gun-metal minerality, the wine cloaks itself in a light coat of ash and stone. Crisp acidity puts a tight focus on the stylish, resonant finish. Delicious now, it's built to age. Drink now–2030.

title: Biecher & Schaal 2014 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Ripe Mirabelle plums and tart, red apples mix to give a very fruity, appetizing aspect which on the palate is joined by ripe, lemony freshness. This has the balance and drama everyone wishes for in dry Riesling: both generous fruit and ample freshness. Lovely now but with the balance and concentration to last. Lovely Mirabelle finish of immense length. Drink 2016–2026.

title: Château Laroque 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Powerful and ripe, this is a solid, serious wine. It has dark tannins that are integrated into the rich black fruits. The wood is filling the texture with spice and a touch of bitter chocolate. It will be a full, dense wine, lifted by its juicy acidity.

title: Château Magrez Fombrauge 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Chocolate and ripe berry flavors give the wine a full, opulent character. It has some rich, sweet tannins that fill out the bountiful fruits. The wine is in a style that takes full advantage of the quality of the vintage.

title: Cristom 2013 Louise Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Set at the top of Cristom's excellent lineup, this lush, round and seductive wine is built upon ripe black-cherry fruit. It plays out broadly across the palate, open and smooth, with nuances of cola, sandalwood and spice. Crisp, natural acidity keeps it lifted and lively. Drink now through 2035.

title: Dominio de Atauta 2011 Valdegatiles  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Lush prune and raisin aromas stop short of being mushy and make way for fresher notes of black currant and toast. Saturated, dense and chewy on the palate, this tastes ripe and toasty, with hefty blackberry and chocolate flavors. Additional toastiness and peppery spice flavors work the finish on this generous Tempranillo from an excellent vintage. Drink from 2017–2030.

title: Domaine Schoffit 2013 Clos Saint-Théobald Schistes Rangen Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: The nose is still closed, there is an almost smoky aspect and a promise of far more perfume in the future. The palate comes with great concentration of still tightly coiled lemon zest notes but the aftertaste is almost salty. This is dry, linear, muscular and toned, affording glimpses of future grandeur through dense lemon and lime zestiness. Give this some time in bottle. Drink 2018–2030.
designation: Clos Saint-Théobald Schistes Rangen Grand Cru

title: Kaiken 2010 Mai Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This lush, extracted Malbec oozes grapy aromas of blackberry and cassis. The palate matches the nose: it's intense and fully extracted. Toasty oak frames blackberry and marzipan flavors prior to a rich finish that's almost syrupy. This is a monster Malbec. Drink through 2022.

title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2011 Trenton View Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a complex wine, jammy and funky in pomegranate and orange notes that are acid-driven but not lacking in fruit or spice components. Soft and silky on the palate, it conveys a twinge of sandalwood to round things out on the long finish.

title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2013 Kent the Younger Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: High in acidity and well-defined minerality, this wine is also soft and velvety, with a sensibility of crushed rocks and preserved lemon. From a younger block of the famed Ritchie Vineyard, it celebrates youthful playfulness on the palate, with a long-lasting, voluptuous finish.

title: Liberalia 2011 Cinco  (Toro)
description: This is the best wine from Liberalia we've reviewed to date. Jammy blackberry, wild raspberry and licorice aromas are controlled but potent. Flush, dense and wide on the palate, this features manageable tannins along with pure blackberry and cassis flavors touched up by toasty oak. Espresso and burnt toast notes take over on the finish as the fruit slips away. Drink through 2030.

title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2014 Kaseler Nies'chen GG Trocken Riesling (Mosel)
description: Wisps of smoke and slate extend savory, mineral contrasts to sun-kissed grapefruit and tangerine flavors in this penetrating dry Riesling. It's nervy and brisk, anchored by strikes of lime and lemon acidity and a lingering, steely finish. It's a powerful wine that should continue to improve through 2025.

title: Tapiz 2011 Black Tears Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Pure, ripe blackberry aromas are heady, toasty and crisp like burnt bread crust. This Malbec has a profound, drawing mouthfeel defined by full extraction and muscular tannins. Savory flavors of blackberry and roasted plum end with depth, focus and welcome freshness. Drink through 2023.

title: Campillo 2005 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Complex aromas of olive, dried leaves, kirsch and cassis set up a spunky, acid-rich palate that's integrated and well balanced. Flavors of vanilla, herbs, tobacco and earthy plum and raspberry finish with elegance and thoroughness. This intense, pure gran reserva will age well for another 15 years, maybe longer.

title: Château Margaux 2015 Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is pure Sémillon, with gorgeous hints of orange as well as riper yellow fruits. It is a precise wine, pointed beautifully with highlights of crisp apple and acidity.
designation: Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux Barrel Sample

title: Château Pape Clément 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Powerful and with a sense of dark extraction, this is a concentrated wine. It has chocolate as well as dark plum flavors that offer a dense counterpoint to the fresher aftertaste.

title: Château Quintus 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Big, bold and juicy, this is a step up from previous vintages of this wine, owned by Haut-Brion. It has ripe tannins and concentration with spice and broad acidity. Black fruits go with the red fruit flavors to give a rich, generous wine.

title: Domaine Delaporte 2014 Maxime Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre)
description: This is a full-bodied wine that exudes yellow fruits and a smooth structure. It is ripe, packed with citrus acidity to keep it fresh while the mineral texture is so well-cushioned by the rich fruitiness. It is delicious now with the exuberance of young fruit although it will certainly age and will be even better from 2017.

title: Château Angélus 2015 Le Carillon d'Angélus Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a stylish wine, now made from its own dedicated vines. It has firm tannins that are generous, supported by opulent fruit structure. The line of acidity that gives the wine its poise goes right through to the end.

title: Château Canon la Gaffelière 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Perfumed and fruity, this crisp wine is shot through with acidity as well as bright black-currant flavors. The tannins are smoky, hinting at the wood aging, although they're likely to integrate well with the fine fruitiness.

title: Château La Tour Figeac 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is packed with ripe, pure fruitiness. It has delicious black-currant fruits that are shot through with acidity and soft tannins. At the end, attractive freshness is a fine contrast to the structure.

title: Adelsheim 2013 Winderlea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Once again this designate amazes with a surfeit of beautifully integrated flavors. Mushrooms and baking spices adorn an explosion of strawberry pastries. There's plenty of ripe cherry fruit also, and a long, polished, lip-licking finish.

title: Domaine Schoffit 2010 Rangen Grand Cru Clos Saint Théobald Sélection de Grains Nobles Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: The nose is shy but the palate is an enticing, delicious clash of honeyed, sweet richness—think blossom honey and dripping caramel, with the tart lurid freshness of lemon oil. This is alive and enlivening in its contrast and moreishness. The finish is lip-smacking and long, holding secrets of honeyed apricots and pears.
designation: Rangen Grand Cru Clos Saint Théobald Sélection de Grains Nobles

title: Domaine Schoffit 2010 Rangen Grand Cru Clos Saint Théobald Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: A shy nose opens onto a fruit-driven, scented palate of honeyed pear. Flavors are delicate but well-defined, the purity of the honey notes is astonishing and appetizing. Balance comes from a golden vein of citrus freshness. This is subtle and sweet: you need to let this come towards you slowly and let the waves of balanced sweetness unfold. This is a very elegant, impressive vendange tardive.
designation: Rangen Grand Cru Clos Saint Théobald Vendanges Tardives

title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2012 Hawk Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Crisp lemon and a light touch of oak provide a framework around memorably spicy bits of lemongrass and ginger. Along with a tightness of minerality, there's a complexity and succulence to this wine, which lingers elegantly in all of its elements on the finish.

title: Martin Schaetzel 2013 Eichberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Very pure notes of red apple and Bosc pear on the nose relax into a juicy, delicious mix on the dry, poised palate. The abundance of fruit cannot conceal the absolute purity and concentration at the core of this dry, structured wine. This strikes a wonderful balance and finishes dry and long.

title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2014 Graach Josephshöfer Monopol Spätlese Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)
description: A rich layer of caramelized honey penetrates through bristling limes, lemons and tangerines in this sprightly medium-sweet Riesling. It's light as a feather yet pulsating with sweet yellow peach and apricot flavors. Vibrantly acidic but nuanced and substantial, it drinks gorgeously now but has enough substance to age well through at least 2025.
designation: Graach Josephshöfer Monopol Spätlese Grosse Lage

title: Shea 2013 Homer Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Homer is the reserve cuvée, a barrel-selection seemingly chosen for a bit of extra concentration. It retains its elegance, with scents of lavender, incense and Asian spices leading into bright, intense flavors of cherry and plum. The wine gathers itself in the midpalate, showing that fruit density, and finishes with a lick of chocolate. Drink 2018–2030.

title: Quinta do Vallado NV 30 Years Old Tawny  (Port)
description: A 30-year-old tawny that shows great intensity and rich dried fruits and honey as well as the woody flavors from long aging in barrel. It's a very fine wine, dry in character with touches of bitter marmalade and finished with intense acidity. Like all tawnies, the wine is ready to drink.
